message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.IR. 

The paper proposes a neural model for reading comprehension over long narratives, which falls under the natural language processing (NLP) domain. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also uses curriculum learning, which is a technique commonly used in machine learning (ML) to improve model performance, suggesting that it could also belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) or cs.LG (Machine Learning). The proposed model uses a Pointer-Generator framework, which is a type of neural network architecture, indicating that it could also be classified under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper evaluates its proposed method on a reading comprehension benchmark, which is a task related to information retrieval (IR), suggesting that it could also belong to cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
